department: Art of Africa and the Americas
description: Two panel huipil with slit neck opening; white ground cloth with supplementary weft patterning primarily in red, with accents in pink, black, blue, purple and yellow; thin multi-colored stripes at shoulder with a wide block of red weft face directly underneath; halfway down the garment is a band of horse motifs with multi-colored stripes below; lower third of garment is plain white.
medium: Cotton, wool, silk; supplementary weft patterning
title: Woman's blouse (Huipil)
